Author: chvsnaveen12
Content: Alright, could you let me know both of the options? If there is a free slot available and if I have to pay for a full/half slot how much would that be?

Author: mithro_
Content:
@chvsnaveen12 - Currently payment is $7k / $8.5k USD for a slot and kind of needs to have been done yesterday. CrowdSupply might be willing to make that happen for you.

There is currently no way to "pay" for a half slot. Basically you need to have something on the platform.wafer.space site which is manufacturable at the time of assignment.

Author: chvsnaveen12
Content: Oh alright. Thanks for the info. Given the scenario, We'll try to put our design on the platform right now for half a slot. Probably for the next shuttle we'll purchase a full slot.

Author: mithro_
Content: With the number of people saying they are looking to purchase slots on the second shuttle, I'm starting to wonder if we might actually sell out.....

Author: scafir
Content: Hey, seems like  the pdk's run_drc.py` (klayout) does not run dummy checks for DRC. I don't quite understand how precheck runs the klayout drc. Could this be a problem?

Author: securitybrahh
Content: Do you do freepdk-45 or sky90?

Author: chvsnaveen12
Content: Let's hypothetically say that you guys choose to manufacture the design, how much would I need to pay for the bonded dies to PCBs?

Author: mole99
Content: The precheck runs DRC through LibreLane, including dummy checks, so that is not a problem. However, we should update the `run_drc.py` in this case.

Author: scafir
Content: Good! II guess we could integrate the dummy checks in the feol checks rather than keep this switch

Author: mithro_
Content: I haven't quite figured out what I'm doing regarding COB stuff for the free slots yet....

Author: mole99
Content:
Yes, that was done in this PR: https://github.com/wafer-space/gf180mcu/pull/1
But we can move it to any other.

Author: chvsnaveen12
Content: Alright, if there's any update do let me know. We'll be willing to pay for the packaging and other charges if it proceeds to manufacturing.

Author: mithro_
Content: I'm currently planning on the idea that people who have done designs that we have manufactured for free end up with something useful for them without having to pay. The exact details are still unknown and depends on lots of different things and unclear if it is even worth the hassle for there to be options to pay something to get more and such.
